definition: to thwart/to foil (sb's plans)/a setback/a failure/a defeat
obstructed/to fail/to oppress/to repress/to lower the tone/to bend back/to dampen
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: Tiamat And the agreement is struck. And Marduk fells Tiamat in battle.
sentences.chinese: 就这样达成了协议，Marduk在战争中挫败了。

sentences.english: The team's efforts to score were frustrated by the opposing goalkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 该队想要进球的努力被对方的守门员挫败了。

sentences.english: His efforts were defeated by the forces of reaction .
sentences.chinese: 他的努力被反动势力挫败。

sentences.english: The militants' attempt to hijack the plane was foiled by the flight crew, the official said.
sentences.chinese: 此官员说飞机乘务组挫败了劫持此飞机的企图。

sentences.english: Never give up of your decision since only one cauce .
sentences.chinese: 不要只因一次挫败，就放弃妳原来决心达到的目的。

sentences.english: His frustration was interrupted when the gargoyle from the roof came crashing through the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 城主的挫败感被一个从房顶穿过入室的恶魔打断了。

sentences.english: Dang it, another major set-back for Egypts space program.
sentences.chinese: 畜生，又是埃及航空计划的一大挫败啊。

sentences.english: Acceptdisa ppointment  and learn to persevere, to pursue your dreamsdesp ite pitfalls.
sentences.chinese: 接受挫败并学会坚持，不畏风险地追求你的梦想。

sentences.english: Don’t tell me that you have the habit of punching the wall to vent your frustration.
sentences.chinese: 你不会告诉我你只会打墙来排解你心中的挫败感吧？

sentences.english: We don’t tend to see it right away until smack it happens again.
sentences.chinese: 我们不容易很快地识别它直到它再次发生时挫败它。

sentences.english: Mr Gusm?o described the incident as a thwarted "coup".
sentences.chinese: 古斯芒先生把这个事件描述为一次被挫败的“政变”。

sentences.english: Their panzers broke these attacks up with long-range fire.
sentences.chinese: 他们的装甲利用射程优势挫败了这些进攻。

sentences.english: Easterlin says this gap comes from frustration over an inability to get married.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯特林说，这种差距来自于无法结婚的挫败感。

sentences.english: Yet the United States should have expected AU pushback.
sentences.chinese: 然而，美国应该已经预料到了非盟的挫败。

sentences.english: Do not , for repulse, give up the purpose that you resolved to effect.
sentences.chinese: 不要因为挫败就放弃你下定决心实现的目标。

definition: to be defeated/to lose/to fail (e.g. experiments)/failure/defeat/CL:次[ci4]
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
